description:
An efficient and scalable RNAseq analysis workflow with interactive report generation.

BISR-RNAseq pipeline submitted for ICIBM-2019.

Submission files for the ICIBM2019 conference
name: BISR-RNAseq

metadata.abstract: © 2019 The Author(s).Background: RNA sequencing has become an increasingly affordable way to profile gene expression patterns. Here we introduce a workflow implementing several open-source softwares that can be run on a high performance computing environment. Results: Developed as a tool by the Bioinformatics Shared Resource Group (BISR) at the Ohio State University, we have applied the pipeline to a few publicly available RNAseq datasets downloaded from GEO in order to demonstrate the feasibility of this workflow. Source code is available here: Workflow: Https://code.bmi.osumc.edu/gadepalli.3/BISR-RNAseq-ICIBM2019 and shiny: Https://code.bmi.osumc.edu/gadepalli.3/BISR_RNASeq_ICIBM19. Example dataset is demonstrated here: Https://dataportal.bmi.osumc.edu/RNA_Seq/. Conclusion: The workflow allows for the analysis (alignment, QC, gene-wise counts generation) of raw RNAseq data and seamless integration of quality analysis and differential expression results into a configurable R shiny web application.
metadata.title: BISR-RNAseq: An efficient and scalable RNAseq analysis workflow with interactive report generation
